column3: 'Soon after starting the research, our crew biosecurity sensors alerted everybody of an active contamination hazard. It turns out the "moss colony" was a group of military grade self-replicating nanobots, capable of disrupting even our advanced environmental protection suits. Mission aborted.

column2: 'It seems this planet once held water and possibly even life. However, orbital scanning shows no signs of vegetation.
column3: 'It seems this planet once held water and possibly even life. However, orbital scanning shows no signs of vegetation.

column1: '5 P Ultranephrite crystals blue big M.prefab

column2: 'The surface of this lifeless planet is covered with patches of Ultranephrite crystals, valued for their exotic components. However, elder species have long ago suggested that these are actually sentient beings living in a much slower time scale. Collecting & processing the larger crystals isn't very costly, but the ultranephrites probably wouldn't survive the experience.
column3: 'The surface of this lifeless planet is covered with patches of Ultranephrite crystals, valued for their exotic components. However, elder species have long ago suggested that these are actually sentient beings living in a much slower time scale. Collecting & processing the larger crystals isn't very costly, but the ultranephrites probably wouldn't survive the experience.

column2: 'Leave the crystals, trust advice from elder species
column3: 'Leave the crystals, trust advice from elder species

column2: 'Mining & processing exotic minerals completed, no accidents reported.
column3: 'Mining & processing exotic minerals completed, no accidents reported.

column2: 'We were halfway through the mining process, when something started bombarding our ship from orbit with warü charges. A huge and angry warp animal. Perhaps a friend of ultranephrites? The creature left us alone after we escaped, but we had already received critical damage.
column3: 'We were halfway through the mining process, when something started bombarding our ship from orbit with warü charges. A huge and angry warp animal. Perhaps a friend of ultranephrites? The creature left us alone after we escaped, but we had already received critical damage.

column2: 'We leave the crystals unharmed. The ship AI commends your ethical behaviour.
column3: 'We leave the crystals unharmed. The ship AI commends your ethical behaviour.

column2: 'This planet features extreme temperatures and intense volcanic activity. Initial scans suggest possibility of volatiles convertible to fuel and explosives. More accurate prospecting requires us to print additional equipment for our utility bots.
column3: 'This planet features extreme temperatures and intense volcanic activity. Initial scans suggest possibility of volatiles convertible to fuel and explosives. More accurate prospecting requires us to print additional equipment for our utility bots.

column2: 'Planetwide mining operations completed. One of our minerbot groups was vaporized due to an unpredictable hyperheat wave, reducing overall operation profitability.
column3: 'Planetwide mining operations completed. One of our minerbot groups was vaporized due to an unpredictable hyperheat wave, reducing overall operation profitability.

column2: 'Prospecting revealed the planet surface layers contain abundant radioactive elements, usable as fuel and explosives. Mining this planet puts our equipment at considerable risk due to violent atmospheric conditions, however.
column3: 'Prospecting revealed the planet surface layers contain abundant radioactive elements, usable as fuel and explosives. Mining this planet puts our equipment at considerable risk due to violent atmospheric conditions, however.

column2: 'We detected a massive hyperheat wave approaching our area of operations and had to abort the mission. Unfortunately, we had to leave some mining equipment behind and it vaporized. We may leave or try again.
column3: 'We detected a massive hyperheat wave approaching our area of operations and had to abort the mission. Unfortunately, we had to leave some mining equipment behind and it vaporized. We may leave or try again.

column2: 'The atmospheric conditions around the mining site intensified several times but we were able to complete the operations without significant accidents.
column3: 'The atmospheric conditions around the mining site intensified several times but we were able to complete the operations without significant accidents.

column2: 'Unexpected atmospheric activity destroyed our prospector bots before they could complete evaluation of the mining prospects.
column3: 'Unexpected atmospheric activity destroyed our prospector bots before they could complete evaluation of the mining prospects.

column2: 'This planet is covered in a beautiful jungle-like ecosystem. The most intelligent species seem to be carnivorous plants, who distribute much of their caught prey as food for other plants. Mothership AI easily learns their language. They call themselves the Givers.
column3: 'This planet is covered in a beautiful jungle-like ecosystem. The most intelligent species seem to be carnivorous plants, who distribute much of their caught prey as food for other plants. Mothership AI easily learns their language. They call themselves the Givers.

column2: '"What is the meaning of life for the Givers?"
column3: '"What is the meaning of life for the Givers?"

column2: 'After carefully relocating an entire forest and all its numerous inhabitants (including insects) our bots created a dome to shield nearby individuals from our mining processes. We then managed to very slowly mine some exotic minerals. The plants expressed their gratitude for not taking any local life. Researching the local ecosystem generated valuable data.
column3: 'After carefully relocating an entire forest and all its numerous inhabitants (including insects) our bots created a dome to shield nearby individuals from our mining processes. We then managed to very slowly mine some exotic minerals. The plants expressed their gratitude for not taking any local life. Researching the local ecosystem generated valuable data.

column2: 'The Givers' delegates explain that to them, the meaning of life is to become the ultimate giver. "Who gives better is better." they explain.
column3: 'The Givers' delegates explain that to them, the meaning of life is to become the ultimate giver. "Who gives better is better." they explain.

column2: 'Explore opportunities for research, harvesting and mining
column3: 'Explore opportunities for research, harvesting and mining

column2: 'the AI translation of the Givers' disposition: "We must protect all life on this planet, we do not agree to trade away any of the local individuals, be they plants or bugs. You may take rocks for free, if you do not disturb the life."
column3: 'the AI translation of the Givers' disposition: "We must protect all life on this planet, we do not agree to trade away any of the local individuals, be they plants or bugs. You may take rocks for free, if you do not disturb the life."

column2: 'Prospecting revealed exotic minerals underground, spread thinly over a wide area. Eco-mining from such a large area would require relocation of billions of individual organisms and be therefore quite costly. Non-ecological mining would kill most of these organisms instead.
column3: 'Prospecting revealed exotic minerals underground, spread thinly over a wide area. Eco-mining from such a large area would require relocation of billions of individual organisms and be therefore quite costly. Non-ecological mining would kill most of these organisms instead.

column2: 'Researching local life generates valuable data Credits. The intelligent plants thank us for respecting their planet and present a gift, a heap of partially digested bugs.
column3: 'Researching local life generates valuable data Credits. The intelligent plants thank us for respecting their planet and present a gift, a heap of partially digested bugs.

column2: 'Our minerbots try to minimize damage to forests, but it is not very successful without relocating the trees and animals on the mining spot. Our minerbots end up killing innumerable local individuals, from insects to animals. On the plus side, we obtain a hefty amount of exotic minerals. The Givers stop speaking to us. We take a few scientific samples and leave.
column3: 'Our minerbots try to minimize damage to forests, but it is not very successful without relocating the trees and animals on the mining spot. Our minerbots end up killing innumerable local individuals, from insects to animals. On the plus side, we obtain a hefty amount of exotic minerals. The Givers stop speaking to us. We take a few scientific samples and leave.

column2: 'The planet is inhabited by a digital-era civilization of avians which seem to be highly militarized. When we get close to the atmosphere, the locals send us a warning to get away from their property or else.
column3: 'The planet is inhabited by a digital-era civilization of avians which seem to be highly militarized. When we get close to the atmosphere, the locals send us a warning to get away from their property or else.

column2: 'Send Tarny bots to scout the planet
column3: 'Send Tarny bots to scout the planet

column2: 'The local militiaries discovered our bots and shot them down.
column3: 'The local militiaries discovered our bots and shot them down.

column2: 'We underestimated the opponent's nuclear arsenal and accidentally caused a nuclear winter with our retaliation. Only a few pockets of survivors remain now and the planet is expected to undergo a major extinction event. We also received some damage ourselves. This is a disaster. At least it's kind of a good campfire story.
column3: 'We underestimated the opponent's nuclear arsenal and accidentally caused a nuclear winter with our retaliation. Only a few pockets of survivors remain now and the planet is expected to undergo a major extinction event. We also received some damage ourselves. This is a disaster. At least it's kind of a good campfire story.

column2: '"We need to have at least two capable crew for this operation."
column3: '"We need to have at least two capable crew for this operation."

column2: 'Our operatives successfully infiltrated the society of the militaristic mammals. They were horrified to see the level of suffering that such a violence-based leadership produces in a civilization. At least now these poor fools have less stuff to kill each other with.
column3: 'Our operatives successfully infiltrated the society of the militaristic mammals. They were horrified to see the level of suffering that such a violence-based leadership produces in a civilization. At least now these poor fools have less stuff to kill each other with.

column2: 'The locals lose their cool as they fear we are trying to manipulate them via communication. They shut all commchannels and launch a primitive nuclear attack against us from their ground bases.
column3: 'The locals lose their cool as they fear we are trying to manipulate them via communication. They shut all commchannels and launch a primitive nuclear attack against us from their ground bases.

column2: 'Send bots & other printed tech to catch the missiles before leaving
column3: 'Send bots & other printed tech to catch the missiles before leaving

column2: 'Start military intervention, force locals to disarm [gain explosives?]
column3: 'Start military intervention, force locals to disarm [gain explosives?]

column2: 'Their technology was better than expected and possibly even disguised to look more primitive. The rockets managed to destroy many of the bots sent to catch them, and one even connected with our ship.
column3: 'Their technology was better than expected and possibly even disguised to look more primitive. The rockets managed to destroy many of the bots sent to catch them, and one even connected with our ship.

column2: 'The militaristic avians have now launched a planetwide primitive nuclear attack against our Mothership from their ground bases.
column3: 'The militaristic avians have now launched a planetwide primitive nuclear attack against our Mothership from their ground bases.

column2: 'Full military intervention, force locals to disarm & demilitarize
column3: 'Full military intervention, force locals to disarm & demilitarize

column2: 'Perhaps the local civilization has a history with hostile aliens. Planetary defence bases are everywhere. Paranoid military leaders are typical for younger species. We could try to steal some of their nuclear weapons. Such an extensive operation requires volunteers to be sent on the planet.
column3: 'Perhaps the local civilization has a history with hostile aliens. Planetary defence bases are everywhere. Paranoid military leaders are typical for younger species. We could try to steal some of their nuclear weapons. Such an extensive operation requires volunteers to be sent on the planet.

column2: 'Send covert operatives to steal nuclear weapons [send crew]
column3: 'Send covert operatives to steal nuclear weapons [send crew]

column2: 'Our operatives were discovered and attacked in the final stages of the operation. Fortunately, advanced suits and a security bot protected them from most of the primitive projectile weapons of the attackers. Mission was aborted but some resources had already been smuggled out of the planet.
column3: 'Our operatives were discovered and attacked in the final stages of the operation. Fortunately, advanced suits and a security bot protected them from most of the primitive projectile weapons of the attackers. Mission was aborted but some resources had already been smuggled out of the planet.

column2: 'Our covert operatives were attacked by a gang belonging to some rival warlord who didn't even know his opponents were our agents in disguise. They used heavy weapons, causing critical wounds to our crew.
column3: 'Our covert operatives were attacked by a gang belonging to some rival warlord who didn't even know his opponents were our agents in disguise. They used heavy weapons, causing critical wounds to our crew.

column2: 'After a series of strategic assassinations by orbital bombardment, the local warlords are ultimately forced to capitulate and disarm. The rebuilding can start but much of the planet is now a nuclear wasteland. We confiscate their remaining nuclear stockpiles.
column3: 'After a series of strategic assassinations by orbital bombardment, the local warlords are ultimately forced to capitulate and disarm. The rebuilding can start but much of the planet is now a nuclear wasteland. We confiscate their remaining nuclear stockpiles.

column2: 'This ship was destroyed less than a few hours ago! Some of the metal is still burning hot and we can clearly see small flames and boarder entry holes, most likely slaver marks. This means survivors are unlikely, but there might still be some resources left.
column3: 'This ship was destroyed less than a few hours ago! Some of the metal is still burning hot and we can clearly see small flames and boarder entry holes, most likely slaver marks. This means survivors are unlikely, but there might still be some resources left.

column2: 'Scavenging operation completed. There wasn't much left besides molten metal.
column3: 'Scavenging operation completed. There wasn't much left besides molten metal.

column2: 'Scavenging operation completed. One of the modules was found repairable.
column3: 'Scavenging operation completed. One of the modules was found repairable.

column2: 'The still burning ship was deemed too unstable for the crew to enter, so they sent in only a few bots. Shortly afterwards, the entire wreckage exploded again, it was probably the reactor core this time.
column3: 'The still burning ship was deemed too unstable for the crew to enter, so they sent in only a few bots. Shortly afterwards, the entire wreckage exploded again, it was probably the reactor core this time.

column2: 'It is a large shipwreck of unknown design, floating in a cloud of debris and starfuel. Closer inspection reveals corrosion and plasma damage marks, indicating a warplife attack.
column3: 'It is a large shipwreck of unknown design, floating in a cloud of debris and starfuel. Closer inspection reveals corrosion and plasma damage marks, indicating a warplife attack.

column2: 'Our salvage teams have scooped up everything of value.
column3: 'Our salvage teams have scooped up everything of value.

column2: 'It is a large shipwreck of unknown design, floating in a cloud of debree and starfuel. Closer inspection reveals corrosion and plasma damage marks, indicating a warplife attack.
column3: 'It is a large shipwreck of unknown design, floating in a cloud of debree and starfuel. Closer inspection reveals corrosion and plasma damage marks, indicating a warplife attack.

column2: 'Our salvage teams have scooped up everything of value, including some pieces off the carcass.
column3: 'Our salvage teams have scooped up everything of value, including some pieces off the carcass.

column2: 'Some kind of metal frame, drifting in space.
column3: 'Some kind of metal frame, drifting in space.

column2: 'It's the central frame of a ship.
column3: 'It's the central frame of a ship.

column2: 'It's an already looted ship hull. Our scavengers took some not-completely-worthless Credits off the hull.
column3: 'It's an already looted ship hull. Our scavengers took some not-completely-worthless Credits off the hull.

column2: 'This small ship is another victim of pirates or slavers. Our scavenger engineers were able to salvage some radioactive elements from its broken reactor.
column3: 'This small ship is another victim of pirates or slavers. Our scavenger engineers were able to salvage some radioactive elements from its broken reactor.

column2: 'Taking a look inside the wreckage, our engineers found an armored cryopod containing a cryofrozen pet. She passed all decontamination procedures and is now an important member of the crew.
column3: 'Taking a look inside the wreckage, our engineers found an armored cryopod containing a cryofrozen pet. She passed all decontamination procedures and is now an important member of the crew.

column1: '5 wr. shipwreck with weapon MT, orbimines.prefab

column2: 'This planet has a promising mineral profile and a moon.
column3: 'This planet has a promising mineral profile and a moon.

column2: 'Unfortunately, the local mineral seams were too deep to consider mining here. Instead, our crew took time to explore around and found some beautiful caverns filled with microbes that produce a mildly narcotic gas. Our crew collected some - mostly for research purposes, of course.
column3: 'Unfortunately, the local mineral seams were too deep to consider mining here. Instead, our crew took time to explore around and found some beautiful caverns filled with microbes that produce a mildly narcotic gas. Our crew collected some - mostly for research purposes, of course.

column2: 'Indeed, it is a crude interplanetary patrol vehicle. Against all odds, its weapon is still functional.
column3: 'Indeed, it is a crude interplanetary patrol vehicle. Against all odds, its weapon is still functional.

column2: 'We encountered a cloud of mobile mines in the upper atmosphere. They attached themselves to the ship's hull and exploded. Perhaps somebody is trying to protect this planet? Or they could be remnants of an ancient war...
column3: 'We encountered a cloud of mobile mines in the upper atmosphere. They attached themselves to the ship's hull and exploded. Perhaps somebody is trying to protect this planet? Or they could be remnants of an ancient war...

column2: 'Unfortunately, the planet proved too poor for mining. However, our sensors detect an artificial object, possibly wreckage on the planet's moon.
column3: 'Unfortunately, the planet proved too poor for mining. However, our sensors detect an artificial object, possibly wreckage on the planet's moon.

column2: 'Leave it be, it could be dangerous
column3: 'Leave it be, it could be dangerous

column2: 'Tests showed the local micro-organism can be filtered out and neutralized by our ship's built-in organics processors. We eco-harvested a good batch of organics (mostly seeds).
column3: 'Tests showed the local micro-organism can be filtered out and neutralized by our ship's built-in organics processors. We eco-harvested a good batch of organics (mostly seeds).

column2: 'The ecosystem on this planet is young and earthlike, featuring beautiful beaches with ideal temperature. However, a strange microorganism seems to live inside most of the local species. We should run comprehensive tests before harvesting any organics.
column3: 'The ecosystem on this planet is young and earthlike, featuring beautiful beaches with ideal temperature. However, a strange microorganism seems to live inside most of the local species. We should run comprehensive tests before harvesting any organics.

column2: 'After using up a significant amount of our own organics for tests, the micro-organism was found to be too chemically unpredictable to allow safe harvesting from this planet. The research results are worth some data creds.
column3: 'After using up a significant amount of our own organics for tests, the micro-organism was found to be too chemically unpredictable to allow safe harvesting from this planet. The research results are worth some data creds.

column2: 'A small station orbits this otherwise uninteresting planet. It is sending a trader signal, but its credentials are unknown.
column3: 'A small station orbits this otherwise uninteresting planet. It is sending a trader signal, but its credentials are unknown.

column2: 'The station seems to be selling exclusively worthless junk, except for a shady pair of Gitchankis. They offer an exotic biotech nuke. No refunds, of course.
column3: 'The station seems to be selling exclusively worthless junk, except for a shady pair of Gitchankis. They offer an exotic biotech nuke. No refunds, of course.

column2: 'It turns out the station sells only ancient farming drones, and these are too large for our ship. However, a shady pair of Gor-Mor offers old, obsolete or broken modules in bulk, for cheap.
column3: 'It turns out the station sells only ancient farming drones, and these are too large for our ship. However, a shady pair of Gor-Mor offers old, obsolete or broken modules in bulk, for cheap.

column2: 'The station replica self-destructed after we had defeated the boarding bots. The techno-junk inside the replica scattered in all directions as shrapnel, causing minor damage to our ship.
column3: 'The station replica self-destructed after we had defeated the boarding bots. The techno-junk inside the replica scattered in all directions as shrapnel, causing minor damage to our ship.

column2: 'The entire structure proves to be a hollow metal replica of a station filled with junk, to trick our sensors. Several very crude, but deadly boarding bots have been detected landing on our ship's hull...
column3: 'The entire structure proves to be a hollow metal replica of a station filled with junk, to trick our sensors. Several very crude, but deadly boarding bots have been detected landing on our ship's hull...

column2: 'The nuke is delivered as promised, although it's broken and must be repaired before use.
column3: 'The nuke is delivered as promised, although it's broken and must be repaired before use.

column2: 'The nuke is delivered as promised. As a symbolic gift, the trader also gives us a container filled some kind of dead birds.
column3: 'The nuke is delivered as promised. As a symbolic gift, the trader also gives us a container filled some kind of dead birds.

column2: 'All of the modules prove to be completely unusable in our ship, but far from worthless, given potentially high scrap value.
column3: 'All of the modules prove to be completely unusable in our ship, but far from worthless, given potentially high scrap value.

column2: 'Initial analysis indicates most of the technology received is both old and in poor shape, but far from worthless, given potentially high scrap value.
column3: 'Initial analysis indicates most of the technology received is both old and in poor shape, but far from worthless, given potentially high scrap value.

column2: 'This heavily damaged ship still has some active systems online. These could be automated defences, of course. Hull design suggests this might be a fuel tanker, though it's impossible to tell for sure.
column3: 'This heavily damaged ship still has some active systems online. These could be automated defences, of course. Hull design suggests this might be a fuel tanker, though it's impossible to tell for sure.

column2: 'The active technology proved to be low-level maintenance systems, nothing dangerous. The ship proved indeed to be a fuel tanker, and there was a good load left in its tanks. We scrapped the entire vessel.
column3: 'The active technology proved to be low-level maintenance systems, nothing dangerous. The ship proved indeed to be a fuel tanker, and there was a good load left in its tanks. We scrapped the entire vessel.

column2: 'The active technology proved to be low-level maintenance systems, nothing dangerous. The ship was transporting minerals and there was a load of volatiles left in its containers.
column3: 'The active technology proved to be low-level maintenance systems, nothing dangerous. The ship was transporting minerals and there was a load of volatiles left in its containers.

column2: 'The planet is an industrial waste ocean. Cheap chemicals were processed here once, with all the toxic byproducts dumped right into water. No signs of life remain. We've located an abandoned central command platform of the past industrial operation. Large sections are under water, and exploring it would require considerable time.
column3: 'The planet is an industrial waste ocean. Cheap chemicals were processed here once, with all the toxic byproducts dumped right into water. No signs of life remain. We've located an abandoned central command platform of the past industrial operation. Large sections are under water, and exploring it would require considerable time.

column2: 'Take time to explore the platform [send crew, -30 organics]
column3: 'Take time to explore the platform [send crew, -30 organics]

column2: 'Self-destruct system scavenged without problems. Printed bots were recycled after the operation.
column3: 'Self-destruct system scavenged without problems. Printed bots were recycled after the operation.

column2: 'The platform is degraded beyond recognition and there was little left to scavenge.
column3: 'The platform is degraded beyond recognition and there was little left to scavenge.

column2: 'The atmosphere seems to be heavily saturated with what looks like various forms of low-tech industrial by-products. The smog is so thick that it prevents us from orbital scanning.
column3: 'The atmosphere seems to be heavily saturated with what looks like various forms of low-tech industrial by-products. The smog is so thick that it prevents us from orbital scanning.

column2: 'The platform is degraded beyond recognition, except for the self-destruct system of the building. It features extensive networks of explosives placed deep within walls. We could retrieve the explosives but it would need specialized bots or risking the crew.
column3: 'The platform is degraded beyond recognition, except for the self-destruct system of the building. It features extensive networks of explosives placed deep within walls. We could retrieve the explosives but it would need specialized bots or risking the crew.

column2: 'The self-destruct system activated during the operation, annihilating the entire complex along with our bots inside. We salvaged a piece of metal frame that survived the explosion.
column3: 'The self-destruct system activated during the operation, annihilating the entire complex along with our bots inside. We salvaged a piece of metal frame that survived the explosion.

column2: 'We were able to scavenge an assortment of synthethic materials and even a piece of technology from the megacity ruins.
column3: 'We were able to scavenge an assortment of synthethic materials and even a piece of technology from the megacity ruins.

column2: 'Ruins of single large megastructure were already visible from orbit. Numerous remains of local artwork show they used to be inhabited by a species of technologically advanced insectoids. The cause of their disappearance is unknown. There's meagre vegetation on the planet, unsuitable for large-scale harvesting.
column3: 'Ruins of single large megastructure were already visible from orbit. Numerous remains of local artwork show they used to be inhabited by a species of technologically advanced insectoids. The cause of their disappearance is unknown. There's meagre vegetation on the planet, unsuitable for large-scale harvesting.

column2: 'We discovered the city still has some active defence mechanisms. The ruins released some kind of nanobots with the capability to fracture plastics, destroying several bots and creating a serious risk for our operatives on the planet. The scavenging mission has been aborted, and decontamination procedures were extensive.
column3: 'We discovered the city still has some active defence mechanisms. The ruins released some kind of nanobots with the capability to fracture plastics, destroying several bots and creating a serious risk for our operatives on the planet. The scavenging mission has been aborted, and decontamination procedures were extensive.

column1: 'P precursor tech MT, possibly dysfunctional visited icon.prefab

column2: 'This planet is devoid of life. Atmospheric bots have found nothing of interest, but deep scans registered a faint warp enegy signature from an underground source. It's either advanced technology or a warp animal. Send bots for a closer look?
column3: 'This planet is devoid of life. Atmospheric bots have found nothing of interest, but deep scans registered a faint warp enegy signature from an underground source. It's either advanced technology or a warp animal. Send bots for a closer look?

column2: 'It was indeed an underground storage facility, filled with valuable resources, including a large container of precursor drugs meant for recreational use. We tried some but decided to reprocess the rest into a base form of exotic minerals - surely the most efficient way to increase our survival chances.
column3: 'It was indeed an underground storage facility, filled with valuable resources, including a large container of precursor drugs meant for recreational use. We tried some but decided to reprocess the rest into a base form of exotic minerals - surely the most efficient way to increase our survival chances.

column2: 'It turns out the "value" was a giant warpworm which had been cryofrozen by precursor technology! Our minerbots accidentally released it by damaging the cryotech, resulting in the hungry worm quicky waking up and swallowing all of our bots and scavenging equipment. It then crawled back underground and we decided to leave it in peace.
column3: 'It turns out the "value" was a giant warpworm which had been cryofrozen by precursor technology! Our minerbots accidentally released it by damaging the cryotech, resulting in the hungry worm quicky waking up and swallowing all of our bots and scavenging equipment. It then crawled back underground and we decided to leave it in peace.

column2: 'The warp energy source is a cheap beacon left behind by a precursor species called the Chrysid. We are not completely sure, but the beacon seems to signify some kind of value storage underground.
column3: 'The warp energy source is a cheap beacon left behind by a precursor species called the Chrysid. We are not completely sure, but the beacon seems to signify some kind of value storage underground.

column2: 'A huge robot seemingly appeared out of nowhere and vaporized our bots. It also shot at our ship in orbit, scorching the hull with rays that effortlessly penetrated energy shields, suggesting some kind of precursor technology. We left as quickly as possible.
column3: 'A huge robot seemingly appeared out of nowhere and vaporized our bots. It also shot at our ship in orbit, scorching the hull with rays that effortlessly penetrated energy shields, suggesting some kind of precursor technology. We left as quickly as possible.

column1: 'Pint primitive milciv, SOS signal and exo trade.prefab

column2: 'The signal came from a crashlanded civilian ship. The single insectoid pilot is unfortunately dead. Pictographic ship's log reveals the pilot was a child, just flying around space and adventuring. Her ship was shot down by a swarm of local nukes. We scavenge everything.
column3: 'The signal came from a crashlanded civilian ship. The single insectoid pilot is unfortunately dead. Pictographic ship's log reveals the pilot was a child, just flying around space and adventuring. Her ship was shot down by a swarm of local nukes. We scavenge everything.

column2: 'The SOS signal came from a crashlanded civilian ship. The unconscious pilot was taken aboard, but local warmachines were detected approaching while we were in the middle of salvaging the ship. Our operatives grabbed everything they could and detonated the remaining wreckage before leaving. The local primitives are not ready for such technology.
column3: 'The SOS signal came from a crashlanded civilian ship. The unconscious pilot was taken aboard, but local warmachines were detected approaching while we were in the middle of salvaging the ship. Our operatives grabbed everything they could and detonated the remaining wreckage before leaving. The local primitives are not ready for such technology.

column2: 'A young intergalactic explorer that we saved after they crashlanded among primitive militarists.
column3: 'A young intergalactic explorer that we saved after they crashlanded among primitive militarists.

column2: 'The planet is inhabited by a primitive digital-era civilization. When we get close to the atmosphere, they send us a radio warning to get away from their property or suffer a nuclear attack. Most interestingly, we also detect an advanced distress signal coming from the surface. Could it be an intergalactic traveller, crashlanded among the primitives?
column3: 'The planet is inhabited by a primitive digital-era civilization. When we get close to the atmosphere, they send us a radio warning to get away from their property or suffer a nuclear attack. Most interestingly, we also detect an advanced distress signal coming from the surface. Could it be an intergalactic traveller, crashlanded among the primitives?

column2: 'Attempt to bargain with leaders of the planet
column3: 'Attempt to bargain with leaders of the planet

column2: 'The local leaders agree to give us escorted right of passage into their planet... in exchange for exotics. They've been visited by other advanced travellers who've told them about their value. However, such strong stuff could be dangerous in the hands of any primitive civilization.
column3: 'The local leaders agree to give us escorted right of passage into their planet... in exchange for exotics. They've been visited by other advanced travellers who've told them about their value. However, such strong stuff could be dangerous in the hands of any primitive civilization.

column2: 'Politely refuse, attempt to visit the SOS signal covertly
column3: 'Politely refuse, attempt to visit the SOS signal covertly

column2: 'Receive rights to visit the SOS signal source [-2 exotics]
column3: 'Receive rights to visit the SOS signal source [-2 exotics]

column2: 'The local military leaders fear we are trying to manipulate them via communication. They shut all commchannels and launch nuclear missiles at us, dealing minor damage. We decide to move on.
column3: 'The local military leaders fear we are trying to manipulate them via communication. They shut all commchannels and launch nuclear missiles at us, dealing minor damage. We decide to move on.

column2: 'We escape in haste, leaving behind utility bots to cover our retreat. One of the hostile warmachines managed to hit a shuttle, but this wasn't enough to prevent our escape.
column3: 'We escape in haste, leaving behind utility bots to cover our retreat. One of the hostile warmachines managed to hit a shuttle, but this wasn't enough to prevent our escape.

column2: 'The signal came from a crashlanded high-tech civilian ship, and its single pilot is dead. Pictographic ship's log reveals the pilot was a child, just flying around space and adventuring. Her ship was shot down by a swarm of local nukes. As we prepare to salvage the vessel, the locals warn that this was not part of the deal. They've surrounded the wreckage with soldiers and primitive tanks. Nothing that our operatives couldn't handle.
column3: 'The signal came from a crashlanded high-tech civilian ship, and its single pilot is dead. Pictographic ship's log reveals the pilot was a child, just flying around space and adventuring. Her ship was shot down by a swarm of local nukes. As we prepare to salvage the vessel, the locals warn that this was not part of the deal. They've surrounded the wreckage with soldiers and primitive tanks. Nothing that our operatives couldn't handle.

column2: 'Attack the guards with everything, salvage the vessel and retreat.
column3: 'Attack the guards with everything, salvage the vessel and retreat.

column2: 'One of our crewmembers took a direct tank shell hit but survived, thanks to the superb frontal armor of our standard environmental suits. We were able to scavenge the wreckage and leave the planet before the locals were able to send in significant reinforcements. A few cruise missiles launched at us were shot down from our ship in orbit.
column3: 'One of our crewmembers took a direct tank shell hit but survived, thanks to the superb frontal armor of our standard environmental suits. We were able to scavenge the wreckage and leave the planet before the locals were able to send in significant reinforcements. A few cruise missiles launched at us were shot down from our ship in orbit.

column2: 'The enemy wasn't ready for our attack and the superb frontal armor of our environmental suits protected the crew from serious damage. We were able to scavenge the wreckage and leave the planet before the locals were able to send in significant reinforcements. A few cruise missiles launched at us were shot down from our ship in orbit.
column3: 'The enemy wasn't ready for our attack and the superb frontal armor of our environmental suits protected the crew from serious damage. We were able to scavenge the wreckage and leave the planet before the locals were able to send in significant reinforcements. A few cruise missiles launched at us were shot down from our ship in orbit.

column2: '"Hello, credentials accepted. Take all the fuel you want!" transmits the outpost AI.
column3: '"Hello, credentials accepted. Take all the fuel you want!" transmits the outpost AI.

column1: 'P city ruins, life destroyed by nanobots M.prefab

column2: 'We were able to scavenge an assortment of various materials from the urban ruins. Cultural research yielded xenodata with historic value. The local ecosystem was destroyed by biochemical warfare by the planet's own inhabitants hundreds of years ago.
column3: 'We were able to scavenge an assortment of various materials from the urban ruins. Cultural research yielded xenodata with historic value. The local ecosystem was destroyed by biochemical warfare by the planet's own inhabitants hundreds of years ago.

column2: 'Ruins of cities dot the planet, but no vegetation or can be detected. Atmospheric analysis also shows unusual lack of micro-organisms. It seems something wiped all life from this planet.
column3: 'Ruins of cities dot the planet, but no vegetation or can be detected. Atmospheric analysis also shows unusual lack of micro-organisms. It seems something wiped all life from this planet.

column2: 'We discovered the reason this planet is so void of life. Apparently, the local leading military developed nanobots to destroy their enemies (locals of different DNA-type) once and for all. Apparently, the nanobots didn't care too much about the specifics of its victims DNA and eventually wiped out all local life. We left the planet after taking the first samples. We spent extra energy to make sure none of the nanobots survived on the surface of our shipl.
column3: 'We discovered the reason this planet is so void of life. Apparently, the local leading military developed nanobots to destroy their enemies (locals of different DNA-type) once and for all. Apparently, the nanobots didn't care too much about the specifics of its victims DNA and eventually wiped out all local life. We left the planet after taking the first samples. We spent extra energy to make sure none of the nanobots survived on the surface of our shipl.

column2: 'We've found a bunch of dead Spideraa bodies, drifting in space.
column3: 'We've found a bunch of dead Spideraa bodies, drifting in space.

column2: 'It is a bunch of dead insectoid bodies, drifting in space. Examination reveals something that look very much like Spideraa biting marks.
column3: 'It is a bunch of dead insectoid bodies, drifting in space. Examination reveals something that look very much like Spideraa biting marks.

column2: 'Some kind of liquid, floating in space as fozen bubbles. Later analysis reveals it is Spideraa blood, probably a result of some kind of ceremony.
column3: 'Some kind of liquid, floating in space as fozen bubbles. Later analysis reveals it is Spideraa blood, probably a result of some kind of ceremony.

column2: 'We found bunch of dead Spideraa bodies, drifting in space. Or so we thought. One of them woke up during the autopsy and attacked our crew. We managed to restrain and sedate it. The AI later spent several hours alone with the creature. In the end, the Spideraa individual joined our crew.
column3: 'We found bunch of dead Spideraa bodies, drifting in space. Or so we thought. One of them woke up during the autopsy and attacked our crew. We managed to restrain and sedate it. The AI later spent several hours alone with the creature. In the end, the Spideraa individual joined our crew.

column2: 'A Spideraa individual without memories, still learning the basics. Undergoing long-term neural training by the ship AI.
column3: 'A Spideraa individual without memories, still learning the basics. Undergoing long-term neural training by the ship AI.

column2: 'We found bunch of dead Spideraa bodies, drifting in space. We brought them aboard for reseach & recycling, but one of them woke up - intruder alert!
column3: 'We found bunch of dead Spideraa bodies, drifting in space. We brought them aboard for reseach & recycling, but one of them woke up - intruder alert!

column2: 'Our bots found an advanced cargo container, in addition to some scraps of metal and composite materials. The container seems to contain advanced technology...
column3: 'Our bots found an advanced cargo container, in addition to some scraps of metal and composite materials. The container seems to contain advanced technology...

column2: 'Our bots found an intact ecopod. Multicellular life inside the dome has been dead for a long time due to erosion of life support. After converting all of the remaining biomass into organics, we realized the dominant fungus colony seeems to have sealed a crack in the pod glass. A coincidence or perhaps, pre-sentients? In either case, we discovered this too late.
column3: 'Our bots found an intact ecopod. Multicellular life inside the dome has been dead for a long time due to erosion of life support. After converting all of the remaining biomass into organics, we realized the dominant fungus colony seeems to have sealed a crack in the pod glass. A coincidence or perhaps, pre-sentients? In either case, we discovered this too late.

column2: 'Something exploded with a spectacular force as soon as our scouting bots approached.
column3: 'Something exploded with a spectacular force as soon as our scouting bots approached.

column2: 'Something made of exteremly high-quality composite metal was destroyed here.
column3: 'Something made of exteremly high-quality composite metal was destroyed here.

column2: 'Among Credits of metal and plastics, we found an intact container of advanced repairfoam. We used it to repair a crack in the ship hull.
column3: 'Among Credits of metal and plastics, we found an intact container of advanced repairfoam. We used it to repair a crack in the ship hull.

column2: 'We found two intact Spideraa wreckages. Unfortunately, our scouting bots triggered some kind of self-destruction reaction. The Spideraa ultra-durable ship plates turned into organic goo within seconds.
column3: 'We found two intact Spideraa wreckages. Unfortunately, our scouting bots triggered some kind of self-destruction reaction. The Spideraa ultra-durable ship plates turned into organic goo within seconds.

column2: 'The Space Eels have reported sighting small arachnid ships in this cluster of asteroids.
column3: 'The Space Eels have reported sighting small arachnid ships in this cluster of asteroids.

column2: 'Let's keep on trying to contact them. Ancient insectoid texts explain there is one thing the Spideraa hold sacred, and that is patience.
column3: 'Let's keep on trying to contact them. Ancient insectoid texts explain there is one thing the Spideraa hold sacred, and that is patience.

column2: 'Two Spideraa ship are approaching us. They do not respond to our commrequests.
column3: 'Two Spideraa ship are approaching us. They do not respond to our commrequests.

column2: 'Let's keep on trying to contact them.
column3: 'Let's keep on trying to contact them.

column2: '"I AM EATER. HUNGER MUST BE FED."
column3: '"I AM EATER. HUNGER MUST BE FED."

column2: 'A black arachnid ship is approaching us. It does not respond to our commrequests. Finally, almost before it gets to tactical range, it transmits a message.
column3: 'A black arachnid ship is approaching us. It does not respond to our commrequests. Finally, almost before it gets to tactical range, it transmits a message.

column2: 'The crew start to discuss the order, but it quickly turns into an argument. Most of the crew wants to just ignore it. But some have decided to sacrifice you, the captain.
column3: 'The crew start to discuss the order, but it quickly turns into an argument. Most of the crew wants to just ignore it. But some have decided to sacrifice you, the captain.

column2: 'A fleet of Spideraa ships emerges from the nearby asteroid field...
column3: 'A fleet of Spideraa ships emerges from the nearby asteroid field...

column2: 'Yes, we bring gifts! We desire to talk with you.
column3: 'Yes, we bring gifts! We desire to talk with you.

column2: '"PATIENT BEINGS. WHAT IS IT YOU DESIRE FROM US? DO YOU BRING GIFT?"
column3: '"PATIENT BEINGS. WHAT IS IT YOU DESIRE FROM US? DO YOU BRING GIFT?"

column2: 'Relay information about the war, ask for help and offer the bartering package.
column3: 'Relay information about the war, ask for help and offer the bartering package.

column2: '"INTERESTING. TALKING FOOD WANTS TALK WITH EATERS. WE LISTEN."
column3: '"INTERESTING. TALKING FOOD WANTS TALK WITH EATERS. WE LISTEN."

column2: 'The transmission broadcasts at normal volume this time. "You offer stone tools, not interesting. Attack interesting, brings many taste of new suffering. Keep your stone tools. We will deliver one attack, to get fresh suffering taste. Goodbye, talking food." The ships vanish from our sensors after relaying the message.
column3: 'The transmission broadcasts at normal volume this time. "You offer stone tools, not interesting. Attack interesting, brings many taste of new suffering. Keep your stone tools. We will deliver one attack, to get fresh suffering taste. Goodbye, talking food." The ships vanish from our sensors after relaying the message.

column2: '"Well, that went a lot better than dying. Now let's get out of here. I've activated a warp beacon to summon our warpgate ship."
column3: '"Well, that went a lot better than dying. Now let's get out of here. I've activated a warp beacon to summon our warpgate ship."

column2: '"YOU CARRY TALKING SPIDER FOOD. GIVE ONE TO TALK, OR DIE." Our ship AI informs us the Spideraa believe their food must be alive and conscious right until the meal is over.
column3: '"YOU CARRY TALKING SPIDER FOOD. GIVE ONE TO TALK, OR DIE." Our ship AI informs us the Spideraa believe their food must be alive and conscious right until the meal is over.

column2: 'Nobody volunteers to be eaten alive by the Spideraa.
column3: 'Nobody volunteers to be eaten alive by the Spideraa.

column2: 'Order the crew to select "a volunteer" to be sacrificed.
column3: 'Order the crew to select "a volunteer" to be sacrificed.

column2: '"Are you sure about giving this order, captain? Let me remind you that our crew has the right to question or disobey any orders, because they all volunteered for the mission. The outcome of such an order would be unpredictable, and not good.
column3: '"Are you sure about giving this order, captain? Let me remind you that our crew has the right to question or disobey any orders, because they all volunteered for the mission. The outcome of such an order would be unpredictable, and not good.

column2: 'Find somebody to sacrifice. We need to do this.
column3: 'Find somebody to sacrifice. We need to do this.

column2: 'Voices are raised, and guns drawn. Before you know it, there is a mutiny and the crew are fighting each other! The Spideraa ships are not moving. Their sensors can see through walls as we do, and they must be enjoying the show...
column3: 'Voices are raised, and guns drawn. Before you know it, there is a mutiny and the crew are fighting each other! The Spideraa ships are not moving. Their sensors can see through walls as we do, and they must be enjoying the show...

column2: 'Side with crew who are defending you
column3: 'Side with crew who are defending you

column2: 'Sacrifice yourself to be eaten alive by the Spideraa
column3: 'Sacrifice yourself to be eaten alive by the Spideraa

column2: 'Let's make one more attempt at contacting the Spideraa, and if this fails, return to Earth.
column3: 'Let's make one more attempt at contacting the Spideraa, and if this fails, return to Earth.

column2: 'The Spideraa ships are moving in to attack us.
column3: 'The Spideraa ships are moving in to attack us.

column2: 'The crew stop fighting, and prepare you to be eaten alive by the Spideraa. The ship prints medicine which fries a crucial part of your neural tissue, making you unable to feel any pain for the rest of your life ...which will hopefully be short. This might help the surviving crew to make a deal with the Spideraa, and save Earth. Their journey continues on...
column3: 'The crew stop fighting, and prepare you to be eaten alive by the Spideraa. The ship prints medicine which fries a crucial part of your neural tissue, making you unable to feel any pain for the rest of your life ...which will hopefully be short. This might help the surviving crew to make a deal with the Spideraa, and save Earth. Their journey continues on...

column2: 'Gradually, the fighting stops. But there is no time for the crew to reconnect with each other, because...
column3: 'Gradually, the fighting stops. But there is no time for the crew to reconnect with each other, because...

column2: 'Let's keep on trying to contact them. Some of them are more talkative than others.
column3: 'Let's keep on trying to contact them. Some of them are more talkative than others.

column2: 'Visit {0} locations with confirmed Spideraa sightings, attempt to establish contact.
column3: 'Visit {0} locations with confirmed Spideraa sightings, attempt to establish contact.

column2: 'Visit 1 location with confirmed Spideraa sightings, attempt to establish contact.
column3: 'Visit 1 location with confirmed Spideraa sightings, attempt to establish contact.

column2: 'A larger Spideraa ship is approaching us...
column3: 'A larger Spideraa ship is approaching us...

column2: 'The planet is covered with a lush ecosystem of easily easily ecoharvestable organics. No signs of sentients.
column3: 'The planet is covered with a lush ecosystem of easily easily ecoharvestable organics. No signs of sentients.

column1: '23 7x Pi Dark Market2 ATKold3, matconvertors, hydrophonics1b.prefab

column2: 'This planet is particularly lifeless, and mostly covered with frozen carbon dioxide. However, somebody is transmitting a strong encrypted radio signal from the planet.
column3: 'This planet is particularly lifeless, and mostly covered with frozen carbon dioxide. However, somebody is transmitting a strong encrypted radio signal from the planet.

column2: 'We find the signal source. It is a private marketplace for traders who do not want too much public attention. These traders must know some smugglers, who in turn know pirates, who sometimes know slavers. This place might have some bad people both among clients and sellers.
column3: 'We find the signal source. It is a private marketplace for traders who do not want too much public attention. These traders must know some smugglers, who in turn know pirates, who sometimes know slavers. This place might have some bad people both among clients and sellers.

column2: 'The market is full of semi-legal junk, uninteresting for our purposes. The only attractive offer is a robust triple cannon. "We found it in some wreckage..." the sellers explain.
column3: 'The market is full of semi-legal junk, uninteresting for our purposes. The only attractive offer is a robust triple cannon. "We found it in some wreckage..." the sellers explain.

column2: 'You inspect the weapon thoroughly before accepting the deal. Except for a few fluid stains (alien blood, most likely), you find it completely functional. The ship's AI later has a chat with you about ethics.
column3: 'You inspect the weapon thoroughly before accepting the deal. Except for a few fluid stains (alien blood, most likely), you find it completely functional. The ship's AI later has a chat with you about ethics.

column2: 'To your relief, the place does not have any obvious connections to sentient slavery. This market seems to be mostly supplied by smugglers and thieves - which, you feel, is much better than pirates and slavers. A local insectoid trader has a particularly attractive offer: some kind of cheap materials convertor. He explains its origins, "An acquintance gave it to me completely willingly."
column3: 'To your relief, the place does not have any obvious connections to sentient slavery. This market seems to be mostly supplied by smugglers and thieves - which, you feel, is much better than pirates and slavers. A local insectoid trader has a particularly attractive offer: some kind of cheap materials convertor. He explains its origins, "An acquintance gave it to me completely willingly."

column2: 'Inspection after purchase reveals that the data plates which should have information on the module's previous owners is completely wiped clean. You ask yourself why this is so and arrive at pessimistic conclusions. You'll be thinking about it before going to sleep. The ship's AI later has a chat with you about ethics.
column3: 'Inspection after purchase reveals that the data plates which should have information on the module's previous owners is completely wiped clean. You ask yourself why this is so and arrive at pessimistic conclusions. You'll be thinking about it before going to sleep. The ship's AI later has a chat with you about ethics.

column2: 'This market seems to be mostly supplied by smugglers and thieves - which is much better than pirates and slavers. Two Gor-Mor traders have a particularly attractive offer: a brand new biosynthesis unit. "We won it in an honest game..." they tell you.
column3: 'This market seems to be mostly supplied by smugglers and thieves - which is much better than pirates and slavers. Two Gor-Mor traders have a particularly attractive offer: a brand new biosynthesis unit. "We won it in an honest game..." they tell you.

column2: 'Inspection after purchase reveals that the data plates which should have information on the module's previous owners is completely wiped clean. You ask yourself why this is so and arrive at pessimistic conclusions. You'll be thinking about it before going to sleep.
column3: 'Inspection after purchase reveals that the data plates which should have information on the module's previous owners is completely wiped clean. You ask yourself why this is so and arrive at pessimistic conclusions. You'll be thinking about it before going to sleep.

column2: 'To your relief, the place does not have any visible connections to sentient slavery. A local Grippy trader has a particularly attractive offer- a food synthesizer. "If you give me some explosives... you'll be basically supporting creation through destruction..." the alien explains.
column3: 'To your relief, the place does not have any visible connections to sentient slavery. A local Grippy trader has a particularly attractive offer- a food synthesizer. "If you give me some explosives... you'll be basically supporting creation through destruction..." the alien explains.

column2: 'Inspection after purchase reveals that the data plates which should have information on modules previous owners is completely wiped clean. You ask yourself why this is so and arrive to pessimistic conclusions. You'll be thinking about it before going to sleep.
column3: 'Inspection after purchase reveals that the data plates which should have information on modules previous owners is completely wiped clean. You ask yourself why this is so and arrive to pessimistic conclusions. You'll be thinking about it before going to sleep.

column2: 'To your relief, the place does not have any obvious connections to sentient slavery. All the items we see on the market are sub-par, except for this one ship weapon that shoots non-deflecting shells. "NEED EXPLOSIVES FOR MORE KILLING" the trader communicates robustly his price.
column3: 'To your relief, the place does not have any obvious connections to sentient slavery. All the items we see on the market are sub-par, except for this one ship weapon that shoots non-deflecting shells. "NEED EXPLOSIVES FOR MORE KILLING" the trader communicates robustly his price.

column2: 'Inspection after purchase reveals that the data plates which should have information on modules previous owners is completely wiped clean. You ask yourself why this is so and arrive to pessimistic conclusions.
column3: 'Inspection after purchase reveals that the data plates which should have information on modules previous owners is completely wiped clean. You ask yourself why this is so and arrive to pessimistic conclusions.

column2: 'To your relief, the place does not have any obvious connections to sentient slavery. However, eating enslaved animals with some form of consciousness seems to be the norm here. A local food trader approaches you with an offer: 200 units of meat of [enslaved and killed] animals, for real cheap. "They didn't suffer much, really..." she explains.
column3: 'To your relief, the place does not have any obvious connections to sentient slavery. However, eating enslaved animals with some form of consciousness seems to be the norm here. A local food trader approaches you with an offer: 200 units of meat of [enslaved and killed] animals, for real cheap. "They didn't suffer much, really..." she explains.

column2: 'Organic biomass, the advanced nanostuff that is universally used for life-support across the galaxy always has to be certified as ethical. This one does not bear any credentials however. You realize there is no guarantee the meat actually came from non-sentients. You'll be thinking about this before you go to sleep.
column3: 'Organic biomass, the advanced nanostuff that is universally used for life-support across the galaxy always has to be certified as ethical. This one does not bear any credentials however. You realize there is no guarantee the meat actually came from non-sentients. You'll be thinking about this before you go to sleep.

column2: 'To your relief, the place does not have any obvious connections to sentient slavery. This market seems to be mostly supplied by smugglers and thieves - which, you feel, is much better than pirates and slavers. A local insectoid trader has a particularly attractive offer: 300 units of old fuel for mere scraps.
column3: 'To your relief, the place does not have any obvious connections to sentient slavery. This market seems to be mostly supplied by smugglers and thieves - which, you feel, is much better than pirates and slavers. A local insectoid trader has a particularly attractive offer: 300 units of old fuel for mere scraps.

column2: 'It turns out the fuel is of very low quality. We will have to reprocess it for use, reducing the final volume.
column3: 'It turns out the fuel is of very low quality. We will have to reprocess it for use, reducing the final volume.

column1: '23 P piece of a giant starship2, good nonweapons.prefab

column2: 'We've discovered an abandoned piece of a gigantic precursor spaceship.
column3: 'We've discovered an abandoned piece of a gigantic precursor spaceship.

column2: 'A central element in the module (because we believe it is the shell of a giant ship module) contained intact technology.
column3: 'A central element in the module (because we believe it is the shell of a giant ship module) contained intact technology.

column2: 'Somebody had booby-trapped the ship part with a nuke! We were lucky that none of the crew was involved in the operation. We lost utility bots printed for the operation.
column3: 'Somebody had booby-trapped the ship part with a nuke! We were lucky that none of the crew was involved in the operation. We lost utility bots printed for the operation.

column2: 'Remote analysis shows the planet has a good chance of containing valuable metals. Prospect?
column3: 'Remote analysis shows the planet has a good chance of containing valuable metals. Prospect?

column2: 'We located an exposed seam of valuable minerals and mined as much as was possible.
column3: 'We located an exposed seam of valuable minerals and mined as much as was possible.

column2: 'Unfortunately, the local mineral resources were too deep in the planet's crust to initiate cost-effective mining. However, we found a pair of ancient bot wrecks. Dissassembling them revealed intact digital memorybanks, yielding data with historic value.
column3: 'Unfortunately, the local mineral resources were too deep in the planet's crust to initiate cost-effective mining. However, we found a pair of ancient bot wrecks. Dissassembling them revealed intact digital memorybanks, yielding data with historic value.

column2: 'We located an exposed seam of valuable minerals and mined as much as we could. Most excitingly, we also found some minerals emitting trace levels of warp energy.
column3: 'We located an exposed seam of valuable minerals and mined as much as we could. Most excitingly, we also found some minerals emitting trace levels of warp energy.

column2: 'Unfortunately, the local mineral resources were too deep in the planet's crust to initiate cost-effective mining.
column3: 'Unfortunately, the local mineral resources were too deep in the planet's crust to initiate cost-effective mining.

column2: 'We discovered a few inactive research satellites orbiting the planet. Salvaging them yielded valuable scientific information about the location.
column3: 'We discovered a few inactive research satellites orbiting the planet. Salvaging them yielded valuable scientific information about the location.

column2: 'Unfortunately, the local mineral resources were too deep in the planet's crust to initiate cost-effective mining. However, we found a pair of ancient bot wrecks. Dissassembing them revealed intact technology.
column3: 'Unfortunately, the local mineral resources were too deep in the planet's crust to initiate cost-effective mining. However, we found a pair of ancient bot wrecks. Dissassembing them revealed intact technology.

column2: 'The local anarchists liked us. After having a warm chat with our AI, their community held a vote and decided to support our mission. They gave us some fuel and organics from their reserves.
column3: 'The local anarchists liked us. After having a warm chat with our AI, their community held a vote and decided to support our mission. They gave us some fuel and organics from their reserves.

column2: 'This planet is a colony of an advanced civilization, a multispecies community of anarchists. The anarchists faction is well known in the galaxy, mostly because of their affinity to various forms of pleasure and lack of political attributes, such as having a faction name.
column3: 'This planet is a colony of an advanced civilization, a multispecies community of anarchists. The anarchists faction is well known in the galaxy, mostly because of their affinity to various forms of pleasure and lack of political attributes, such as having a faction name.

column2: 'The community of anarchists liked our crew very much and invited them to partake of many local sensual pleasures. Their life in the domes is mostly dedicated to art, philosphy and various forms of love. This all was very nice, except for the fact that one of our crew insisted on staying. The anarchists gave us exotic consumables as a farewell gift.
column3: 'The community of anarchists liked our crew very much and invited them to partake of many local sensual pleasures. Their life in the domes is mostly dedicated to art, philosphy and various forms of love. This all was very nice, except for the fact that one of our crew insisted on staying. The anarchists gave us exotic consumables as a farewell gift.

column2: 'The community of anarchists invited us to partake of many local sensual pleasures. After several days of joint welcoming celebrations, including private sessions with our AI (and consuming of numerous recreational substances), two of the locals decided to join our mission - "for funwirs," as they said. We received many gifts.
column3: 'The community of anarchists invited us to partake of many local sensual pleasures. After several days of joint welcoming celebrations, including private sessions with our AI (and consuming of numerous recreational substances), two of the locals decided to join our mission - "for funwirs," as they said. We received many gifts.

column2: 'An adventurer from a colony of existential anarchists. Great personality.
column3: 'An adventurer from a colony of existential anarchists. Great personality.

column1: '2356 P big precursor robot makes gift T, LRsensor3, Shield3.prefab

column2: 'The robot nods simply and looks intensely at the ground in front of it. Pieces of planet surface come adrift and start to transform. In a few minutes, a fully functional shield module is formed. "TAKE, GO" the robot says and goes silent.
column3: 'The robot nods simply and looks intensely at the ground in front of it. Pieces of planet surface come adrift and start to transform. In a few minutes, a fully functional shield module is formed. "TAKE, GO" the robot says and goes silent.

column2: 'The warp energy emanates from a large robot, possibly of prercursor origin. The robot communicates "SAFETY" via pictographic holograms.
column3: 'The warp energy emanates from a large robot, possibly of prercursor origin. The robot communicates "SAFETY" via pictographic holograms.

column2: 'This lifeless planet has a warp energy source on its surface. It could be precursor technology, or possibly a warp animal, although they usually do not land on planets.
column3: 'This lifeless planet has a warp energy source on its surface. It could be precursor technology, or possibly a warp animal, although they usually do not land on planets.

column2: 'You suddenly get an unnerving feeling that somebody is actively reading your mind. "YOU NEED HELP" the robot states coldly in your head, "MAKE CHOICE". You feel as if somebody is poking three mental concepts in your head.
column3: 'You suddenly get an unnerving feeling that somebody is actively reading your mind. "YOU NEED HELP" the robot states coldly in your head, "MAKE CHOICE". You feel as if somebody is poking three mental concepts in your head.

column2: 'The robot nods simply and looks intensely at the ground in front of it. Pieces of planet surface come adrift and start to transform. In a few minutes, the Credits grow into some kind of alien technology. "TAKE, GO" the robot says and goes silent.
column3: 'The robot nods simply and looks intensely at the ground in front of it. Pieces of planet surface come adrift and start to transform. In a few minutes, the Credits grow into some kind of alien technology. "TAKE, GO" the robot says and goes silent.

column2: 'When you order your transporters to pick up the piece, they discover it's made of sugar!\n"OFFENCE TRICK QUESTION. NO HELP TO OFFENCE" The robot communicates and becomes silent. There is nothing else for you to do on this lifeless planet. Somebody suggests we could try destroying and scavenging the robot.
column3: 'When you order your transporters to pick up the piece, they discover it's made of sugar!\n"OFFENCE TRICK QUESTION. NO HELP TO OFFENCE" The robot communicates and becomes silent. There is nothing else for you to do on this lifeless planet. Somebody suggests we could try destroying and scavenging the robot.

column2: 'The robot nods simply and looks intensely at the ground in front of it. Pieces of planet surface become afloat and start to transform, organizing into a huge weapon module. This is the most badass weapon you have ever seen.
column3: 'The robot nods simply and looks intensely at the ground in front of it. Pieces of planet surface become afloat and start to transform, organizing into a huge weapon module. This is the most badass weapon you have ever seen.

column2: '"May I remind you of rumors that entire stellar empires have been destroyed by singular Precursor ships. Attacking a Precursor robot would likely be a suicide." the Mothership AI notes. You don't know however if this is a true Precursor robot. It certainly has advanced technology. But perhaps it's not even military-capable?
column3: '"May I remind you of rumors that entire stellar empires have been destroyed by singular Precursor ships. Attacking a Precursor robot would likely be a suicide." the Mothership AI notes. You don't know however if this is a true Precursor robot. It certainly has advanced technology. But perhaps it's not even military-capable?

column2: 'Attack the robot from distance with everything you have
column3: 'Attack the robot from distance with everything you have

column2: 'As soon as you mentally make the decision to try and attack the robot, something strange happens. The entire Mothership, its shuttles, bots and landing crew are taken hold of by an invisble, gravity-like force. The force levitates all of this stuff in terrible speed until it reaches the orbit. Luckily all of the crew had suits on, but some of our bots broke during the lift-off.
column3: 'As soon as you mentally make the decision to try and attack the robot, something strange happens. The entire Mothership, its shuttles, bots and landing crew are taken hold of by an invisble, gravity-like force. The force levitates all of this stuff in terrible speed until it reaches the orbit. Luckily all of the crew had suits on, but some of our bots broke during the lift-off.

column2: 'The warp energy comes from a hill-sized robot. Its unusual design suggests very advanced technology. As we send bots to investigate, the robot hacks one of them and it forwards a simple message "SLEEPING. GO AWAY." We opt for caution and leave after taking a few scientific samples of soil microbiology.
column3: 'The warp energy comes from a hill-sized robot. Its unusual design suggests very advanced technology. As we send bots to investigate, the robot hacks one of them and it forwards a simple message "SLEEPING. GO AWAY." We opt for caution and leave after taking a few scientific samples of soil microbiology.

column2: '"YOU ARE CORRECT." the robot transmits and falls silent. Further investigation proves there is nothing more for us to do with the robot. We take a few scientific samples of the local soil microbiology and leave.
column3: '"YOU ARE CORRECT." the robot transmits and falls silent. Further investigation proves there is nothing more for us to do with the robot. We take a few scientific samples of the local soil microbiology and leave.

column2: 'The warp energy comes from a hill-sized robot. Its unusual design suggests very advanced technology. As we send bots to investigate, the robot hacks one of them and transmits a simple message "ARE YOU UNWISE?"
column3: 'The warp energy comes from a hill-sized robot. Its unusual design suggests very advanced technology. As we send bots to investigate, the robot hacks one of them and transmits a simple message "ARE YOU UNWISE?"

column2: 'Take some soil samples from another area & leave
column3: 'Take some soil samples from another area & leave

column2: '"YOU ARE CLEVER, READ DATA, BECOME WISE." says the robot, and transmits an incredibly powerful datasurge through the channel. It seems to be a collection of billions of philosophic works, from galaxies we haven't even heard about.
column3: '"YOU ARE CLEVER, READ DATA, BECOME WISE." says the robot, and transmits an incredibly powerful datasurge through the channel. It seems to be a collection of billions of philosophic works, from galaxies we haven't even heard about.

column2: 'We opt for caution and choose to not answer the question. Instead, we leave the vicinity of the robot and take a few scientific samples of the soil microbiology.
column3: 'We opt for caution and choose to not answer the question. Instead, we leave the vicinity of the robot and take a few scientific samples of the soil microbiology.

column2: 'Something on the surface of this planet is broadcasting a very faint encrypted message. This could be an alien SOS or perhaps, a trap.
column3: 'Something on the surface of this planet is broadcasting a very faint encrypted message. This could be an alien SOS or perhaps, a trap.

column2: 'The signal was emitted by an automatic beacon of unknown origin, next to a heap of containers waiting to be picked up.
column3: 'The signal was emitted by an automatic beacon of unknown origin, next to a heap of containers waiting to be picked up.

column2: 'The signal was being emitted by an alien intergalactic bot, probably lost during a reconnaissance mission. Disassembling it revealed a crucial part of ship technology and some valuable tech data.
column3: 'The signal was being emitted by an alien intergalactic bot, probably lost during a reconnaissance mission. Disassembling it revealed a crucial part of ship technology and some valuable tech data.

column2: 'The signal was emitted by an automatic beacon, next to a small heap of unmarked resource packs waiting to be picked up.
column3: 'The signal was emitted by an automatic beacon, next to a small heap of unmarked resource packs waiting to be picked up.

column2: 'The signal was emitted by an automatic beacon of unknown origin, next to heap of containers waiting to be picked up.
column3: 'The signal was emitted by an automatic beacon of unknown origin, next to heap of containers waiting to be picked up.

column3: 'This planet is particularly lifeless, and mostly covered with frozen carbon dioxide. Somebody is transmitting an encrypted radio signal from the surface.

column3: 'The signal source is a private marketplace for traders who do not want too much public attention. There's a big pictographic sign explaining "payment in exotics only!"

column2: 'Two of the Gitchanki traders have a particularly attractive offer: "Two pristine multibarrel lasers for mere scraps! The salesmen explain the origin of their wares as "They were just lying around somewhere."
column3: 'Two of the Gitchanki traders have a particularly attractive offer: "Two pristine multibarrel lasers for mere scraps! The salesmen explain the origin of their wares as "They were just lying around somewhere."

column2: 'After taking the shipment aboard, we discover an amputated insectoid hand stuck within the rotational part of the laser turret. We give it a quick recycling ritual.
column3: 'After taking the shipment aboard, we discover an amputated insectoid hand stuck within the rotational part of the laser turret. We give it a quick recycling ritual.

column3: 'To your relief, the place does not have any obvious connections to sentient slavery. You see various slaved animals being sold, however, among weapons and other criminalized objects. A local Gon-Bu trader has a particularly attractive offer: a fully automatic rapid fire cannon.

column3: 'To your relief, the place does not have any obvious connections to sentient slavery. A local trader has a particularly cheap offer: 220 organics of unknown source for mere scraps! ("I guess we all get eaten in the end" remarks the trader).

column2: 'To our relief, the place does not have any obvious connections to sentient slavery. We don't find anything useful for our ship, except a bulk offer of explosives.
column3: 'To our relief, the place does not have any obvious connections to sentient slavery. We don't find anything useful for our ship, except a bulk offer of explosives.

column2: 'Inspection after purchase reveals some of the explosives to have dangerously low quality. About half of them will have to be discarded and used as synthethics. Too late to complain now, the salesman has vanished from the market.
column3: 'Inspection after purchase reveals some of the explosives to have dangerously low quality. About half of them will have to be discarded and used as synthethics. Too late to complain now, the salesman has vanished from the market.

column2: 'Operation completed without problems. We may repeat the transaction.
column3: 'Operation completed without problems. We may repeat the transaction.

column2: 'This is one of the ancient Intergalactic Public Matter Processors. These famous facilities were built by older races for public use centuries ago. They are still working after hundreds of years of service. We may convert some of our resources to others.
column3: 'This is one of the ancient Intergalactic Public Matter Processors. These famous facilities were built by older races for public use centuries ago. They are still working after hundreds of years of service. We may convert some of our resources to others.

column2: 'This is one of the ancient Intergalactic Public Matter Processors. These facilities were built by older civilizations for public use centuries ago. They are still working after hundreds of years of service. We may convert some of our resources to others.
column3: 'This is one of the ancient Intergalactic Public Matter Processors. These facilities were built by older civilizations for public use centuries ago. They are still working after hundreds of years of service. We may convert some of our resources to others.

column2: 'Time has degraded efficiency of the facility, as it was able to generate less fuel than expected. We may repeat the process any time.
column3: 'Time has degraded efficiency of the facility, as it was able to generate less fuel than expected. We may repeat the process any time.
